thread.title: Read Conmigo and Infinity Auto Insurance presents $3.5 Million in support of "Step Up For Students"
thread.title_full: Read Conmigo and Infinity Auto Insurance presents $3.5 Million in support of "Step Up For Students" - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Read Conmigo and Infinity Auto Insurance presents $3.5 Million in support of "Step Up For Students"
text:
Infinity Auto Insurance and their award-winning bilingual literacy campaign for children, Read Conmigo, presented a $3.5 million check to “Step Up for Students,” a nonprofit organization that administers scholarships to children who face educational challenges and live in or near poverty in Florida.
Miami, FL (PRWEB) October 01, 2015
Recently, Infinity Auto Insurance and their award-winning bilingual literacy campaign for children, Read Conmigo, presented a $3.5 million check to “Step Up For Students” at Kingdom Academy in West Kendall. Kingdom Academy is part of more than 1,500 private schools throughout Florida that participate in the Step Up for Students Scholarship Program.
Since 2011, Infinity Auto Insurance has contributed $9.5 million in the name of Read Conmigo, the company’s bilingual literacy program, that has in turn funded 1,841 scholarships to Florida’s underprivileged schoolchildren.
Step Up For Students helps administer the Florida Tax Credit Scholarship Program, which enables companies, like Infinity Auto Insurance, to redirect a portion of their Florida tax liabilities to fund scholarships.
During the 2015-16 school year, more than 77,000 students in kindergarten through 12th grade are attending either an out-of-district public school or private school of their choice with help from a Step Up scholarship. Step Up For Students has provided more than 475,000 scholarships to Florida students since the program’s inception in 2001.
Captions:
Picture 1: The scholarship recipients show Read Conmigo representatives around their classroom.
